message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CE 

The paper discusses a cloud controller for dynamic resource reallocation in geographically-distributed data centers, which involves optimizing for energy costs based on time- and location-dependent factors such as electricity prices and temperatures. This falls under the category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC). Additionally, the paper uses time series forecasting methods to predict future energy costs, which is related to Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). The controller is designed to make decisions based on QoS impact and data quality limits, which is related to Systems and Control (cs.SY) and Computer Engineering (cs.CE).
